revised_title: Investigating Glucoside Fermentation by Bacteria of the Typhoid-coli Group and the Acquisition of New Fermenting Powers by Bacillus Dysenteriae and Other Micro-organisms
tldr: This study investigates the fermentation of 49 glucosides by 18 species of bacteria belonging to the typhoid-coli group. The results show that some bacteria can acquire new fermenting powers, challenging the classification of these microorganisms into distinct species or subgroups based solely on their fermentation reactions.
